vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἔξεστι,
imperative ἐξέστω, subjunctive ἐξῇ, infinitive ἐξεῖναι, participle ἐξόν: imperfect ἐξῆν: future ἐξέσται, optative ἐξέσοιτο [Refs 5th c.BC+]participle ἐξεσόμενον (see. below): impersonal (see. ἔξειμι B):—it is allowed, is possible, with infinitive, [Refs 5th c.BC+]: with dative person et infinitive,[Refs 5th c.BC+]'licet esse beatis', [Refs 4th c.BC+]: with accusative instead of second dative, ἔ. ὑμῖν φίλους γενέσθαι [Refs 5th c.BC+]: with accusative person et infinitive, [Refs 5th c.BC+]participle absolutely, ἐξεόν τοι.. ἕτερα ποιέειν since it was possible for thee to.., [Refs 5th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: it is legal, it is proper, it is permitted
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
it is legal, it is proper, it is permitted
3rd person sing of the unused ἔξειμι ( 1997) used impersonally, it is possible; it is permitted, it is lawful,proper, permitted Mt. 12:2, 4; Mk. 3:4; Lk. 6:9; Acts 22:25; 1Cor. 6:12
